summary: A letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the case of United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, producing materials related to an expert witness the government intends to call at trial. The letter includes an index of produced materials and references a protective order.

events.title: Government Produces Expert Witness Materials
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office produces materials related to an expert witness it intends to call at the trial of Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the case of United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, governing the disclosure of materials.

keyFacts: The document is a formal disclosure from the prosecution to the defense in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
The government is producing materials related to an expert witness it plans to call at trial, including interview notes, prior testimony, a CV, and a contract.
The production is governed by a protective order dated July 31, 2020.
The letter lists five defense attorneys representing Ghislaine Maxwell.
The document indicates ongoing pre-trial preparation and evidence exchange in the lead-up to Maxwell's trial.
